name: The Row Barge Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: its ever so slightly off the beaten track, but the food is brilliant ; good home cooked bar meals (not fancy gastropub stuff) good portions and very tasty
reviews.title: best pub grub bar none

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: service was good and the food was very good value for money . We will come back again !
reviews.title: Best Sunday roast lunch in Henley

reviews.text: This pub has the best Sunday roast in Henley. Not easy to find but well worth the effort . Just go up past the town hall on the rght hand side with river behind you. Great roasts - pork, beef and chicken with a great choice of vegetables. Need to book as locals claim it as their own. Love the place. Staff friendly and efficient. Try it. You will not be disappointed ! We are Australian and come here every year.
reviews.title: Brilliant!!!

reviews.text: Catered for a large group of adults and children at very short notice. Nothing was too much trouble and the food was excellent - all very obviously top quality ingredients and home made!! No children's menu - but all adults meals could be scaled down - even going so far as to halve their puddings so that the kids could share. We were staying elsewhere so can't comment on the accommodation - but really can not praise the food and service highly enough. Bar very friendly too - felt like more of a locals pub but we were made to feel very welcome (children included). Is located a little bit further off the beaten track than many other pubs but well worth the short walk. Some of our group even booked for the following night as well!!
reviews.title: A beautiful, characterful place to stay

reviews.text: A beautiful historic local pub. Full of character and spotlessly clean. A warm friendly welcome and a proper show stopper breakfast !!!
reviews.title: Will stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent situation/location. A really old [3-400 years!] inn with 'all mod cons' A little difficult to find - but it's almost in the centre of town! The stairs are a challenge [especially for a six footer!] but, if you remember to duck your head [or wear a crash helmet!] you'll survive! The service was excellent, breakfast a real English one and staff attentive and helpful. We only had a day there, but we will visit again, for more than a day! Only one small problem, parking - but there is a shopping centre car park 4 minutes down hill - free parking between 1730 and 0845!
reviews.title: A GREAT ENGLISH PUB!

reviews.text: I've had the pleasure of staying at the Row Barge on several occasions and always been very happy. You do, of course have to remember that this is a "pub with rooms" and not a swanky hotel, but it's all the better for it. The rooms are all nicely furnished and comfortable, there's free WiFi and just about everything you need to be comfortable.
reviews.title: Great little find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is friendly (as are the natives) and the food is very good indeed (remember to sample a local ale or two). You also MUST try the breakfast... It really ranks up there with the best I've had (and my waistline will testify to sampling a few).
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: All this, right in the heart of Henley and for a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Superb. Just what I was looking for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here while attending a wedding. Many of the other guests had booked into the likes of Hotel du Vin, however we were on a shoestring budget and had resigned ourselves to finding a simple spot just to crash for the night; we were not expecting luxury. When we arrived, the landlady was friendly and helpful. She remarked that the building was 600 years old. This was certainly reflected in the height of the ceilings, which were very low: I had to go up and down the stairs on all fours. I wondered to myself how they got the furniture in.
reviews.title: Extremely comfy bed in an excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend this pub as a place to stay. It is situated within easy walking distance from the centre of Henley with all the amenities that this quaint English town has to offer. The accommodation is very clean and has a friendly atmosphere, and for any Americans who wish to stay I would recommend room number one as the bed is supersize !!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The locals are very chatty and friendly as are the staff, and the bar food and cooked breakfast are excellent.Another review complained about the breakfast, but the staff are so accommodating that I am sure that more options would have been catered for if they had had a friendly word with the chef.
reviews.title: Stumbled upon a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again .. the pub is quite small and higgle de piggledy but this adds to its charm and can only be expected of such an ancient property.
reviews.title: So Friendly

reviews.text: We called ahead but really gave no notice to our visit...about 5 minutes really...but were greeted warmly and had lots of help to unload and carry our luggage. Very spacious clean room and quaint bathroom..well equipped. All floors were sloping but that made it interesting and quirky and niot really unexpected since the pub itself was quite old and historic. Lovely home cooked breakfast in the morning. Friendly locals..A great place to stay!! Try it!You wont be disappointed.
reviews.title: Just the job

reviews.text: What a lovely family run this pub. Very welcoming even though we arrived in the middle of a private wedding party - funnily the party guests weren't as welcoming! Never mind.
reviews.title: Historic B and B in a pub

reviews.text: Great bar, great rooms and great breakfasts. i stayed here with a friend for one night and had a really nice evening. It has a fabulous location being close to the main high street.
reviews.title: Excellent
Clean, great location, friendly staff, great breakfast!
reviews.text: The owner Jo and his partner are charming company.
I highly recommend it and will be going back.
reviews.title: Great value for money, very helpful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Darren
reviews.title: A mixed experience

reviews.text: Me and hubby stayed for 2 nights. 2 minutes walk into centre of town. A friendly, traditional pub, with just 4 rooms. Clean, charismatic rooms, with all you need for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Great location

description: The Row Barge is one of Henley’s oldest coaching inns. Not far from the town centre, you can find us 100 yards from the Town Hall on West Street, just behind the fire station. In a quiet residential area yet only moments from the centre of town and the stunning walks along the Thames, this 16th Century traditional pub will satisfy those in search of a good drink, great home-cooked food and a warm and comforting welcome, for both locals and visitors alike.
